page.title: 08RELIGION
page.content: THERE HAS BEEN VERY LITTLE MOVEMENT OF PEOPLE IN OR OUT OF NORTHWICH FOR MANY DECADES.THUS THE CHURCHES WHICH WERE IMPORTANT A HUNDRED YEARS AGO ARE THE ONES WHICH ARE STILL IMPORTANT AT PRESENT.THERE HAS BEEN VERY LITTLE INFLUX OF PEOPLE FROM PAKISTAN OR INDIA,AS THERE HAS FURTHER NORTH,AND THEREFORE THERE ARE NO ISLAMIC OR MOSLEM CHURCHES IN THE AREA. THE MAIN RELIGION TYPES ARE CATHOLIC, PROTESTANT,BAPTIST AND JEHOVAHS WITNESS.THE LARGEST CHURCH IN THE AREA IS ST.HELENS IN WITTON DISTRICT,WHICH IS PROBABLY THE OLDEST BUILDING IN THE TOWN.THE CATHOLIC CHURCH OF ST.WILFRID IS ON WITTON STREET IN THE CENTRE OF TOWN.TRINITY CHURCH ON CASTLE HILL WAS BUILT BY THE TRUSTEES OF THE WEAVER NAVIGATION TO PROVIDE THE FAMILIES OF RIVER WEAVER BARGEMEN WITH A PLACE OF WORSHIP AS THEY PASSED THROUGH.
